Luigi Ramanti (ph) decided to take a road trip from northern England to Rome, Italy.
So he put Rome into his car's navigation system, and off he went.
He noticed that the route looked a bit short, and he realized why when he arrived in Rom, a German village of less than 70 people - no Colosseum, no Trevi Fountain.
Surprised, he had a minor car crash.
He reportedly still has plans to go to Rome - the Italian one.
